name: Sarabeth's Upper West Side
address: 423 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: Food was on point as always, the only feedback is I wanted coffee with almond milk and they only have oat mill as an alternative. And the avocado toast could have more avocado on it.
Excelentes huevos benedictinos y los demÃ¡s desayunos que probamos. Recomendable.
Staff is very unfriendly, food is overpriced. Would not recommend.
I used to love Sarabeth's but I think the quality has gone down. They overcooked both my steak and eggs so I kind of thought she might comp my appetizer but didn't.
We went for brunch, the service was excellent and the food was as well.
Food was great atmosphere was nice but the terrible was not pleasant at all
Great place for pancakes or eggs. They serve breakfast until 4pm. A nice place to enjoy your food and relax!

Big omelette, but not much else...

Server was so friendly and was so understanding of our picky kids. Food was amazing I had the avacodo toast with an egg and a side of chicken sausage. It was so good I cleaned the plates dry. Definitely a spot to have breakfast, highly recommend to anyone who hasn't been. Definitely will be back to try other things. Please keep up the phenomenal work and chef tha ks for the amazing experience and great food.
Very considerate hostess sat us (two people with hearing problems), in the perfect table. Food is always good.
Wonderful Motherâ€™s Day brunchâ€¦Could not have been better! Delicious food, great service, and lovely setting!

Sarabethâ€™s on the Upper West Side is a true NYC stapleâ€”perfect for brunch or breakfast classics.

We sat outside and ordered the crispy chicken sandwich with gouda, which was huge and packed with flavor. Served on ciabatta with arugula and jam, it hit every taste budâ€”the perfect balance of sweet and savory. The fries on the side were crispy and delicious. We also had the spinach and cheese omeletteâ€”super fluffy eggs, light and right.

Always a reliable go-to for a satisfying brunch.
We had late breakfast here. It was a nice atmosphere and the food was good. Some glasses were not really clean, but other than that the service was nice.

Brief trip to NY would not have been complete without a visit to Sarabeths. The four of us were seated in our own little breakfast nook near the window. Perfect for people watching and conversation. The Goldie lox pop over was without doubt one of the finest breakfasts in recent memory. Weâ€™ll be back next ny trip

Itâ€™s rare that I would post about a restaurant and even rarer that Iâ€™d rave about a chicken dish but the Farm Chicken is incredibly delicious, tender, moist and did I mention delicious?!!! The Caesar salad with the Prix Fixe meal was enough for two to share. The malbec house wine was quite tasty as well. So, definitely try this place out. Outside dining on a very pleasant summer night was also great. Highly recommend this place.

ã¾ãŸNYã§é£Ÿã¹ãŸã„ã€‚
Very nice place to have lunch or dinner with friends

Delicious and super cute spot for brunch with friends or family. Service is super quick once you get your table; however, it does get a little crowded near the host stand, even if you have a reservation. Their popovers are a must have and their omelettes are super fresh. Would definitely come back again.
Classic NYC brunch institution.
so yum!
Sarabeth UWS is the perfect venue before going to Shakespeare in the Park. The restaurant week menu is a great value and the food was delicious.
We had a delicious meal in a wonderful atmosphere with a caring staff. Will happily return any time.
Volvimos por los benedictinos y siguen siendo espectaculares.

Server came over and said â€œHello.â€  I assumed they were coming by to ask if we needed anything.  I skipped the return â€œhelloâ€ and just asked for coffee I got a snippy response.  Thereâ€™s no need for that.  Lifeâ€™s too short for being corrected by a server at a restaurant.
Always nice going to Sarabeth's for a meal. The food is lovely

The few bar seats they had was fully occupied yesterday at 7/29/25 around 5 pm. The male host in a dry manner told us he canâ€™t let us dine in for happy hour. when there was plenty of open table seat available inside. He said we can only dine out in table or wait for the bar. itâ€™s 96 degree hot and humid outside. We left without business unfortunately.
Dinner and brunch were outstanding. The servers are helpful and dedicated to quality service! I love the inside decor and seating!

Hostess told me to wait for a seat at the bar off to the side as its first come first serve. The manager (older lady) comes up to me and rudely tells me to move and that I can't stand there. Told her, the hostess told me to wait here. Patrons at the bar offer to move over and make room for my partner and I, the manager goes over and tells them not to move! Really horrible service and attitude from this manager. Then she sarcastically says, hope you have a good day! as we leave. I see that there are other negative reviews about this same manager at this location regarding lack of etiquette, manners and even racial profiling?

I had a lovely experience at Sarabethâ€™s to celebrate my friendâ€™s birthday. I arrived fifteen minutes early, and I was greeted at the hostess stand where I was given the option to have a drink or the go directly to the table. I had an iced tea at the bar, which was very satisfying and refreshing. We were led to the back room which was extremely dark, so dark that it felt like evening time. This was my least favorite experience of the meal along with finding food tucked into the booth seating under me. The Cesar Salad with grilled chicken was excellent with real anchovy in the dressing and crispy and tasty homemade croutons and Parmesan crisps which were a nice surprise. The chicken was freshly grilled and delicately seasoned. I asked for a surprise cake for my friend and we were delighted by the Raspberry Bread Pudding which had just the right texture - the slightly dense cake matched the perfectly creamy sauce. Overall, the food was very good, as well as the service, but I might request to sit in the front room next time, where there is light, and hopefully not booths packed with old food. The general manager, Sydney, was very nice to write a follow-up email.
Great food and great service! Nice location.

ClÃ¡ssico nova-iorquino, o Sarabethâ€™s Ã© perfeito para um brunch elegante no Upper West Side, com avocado toast cremoso, panquecas fofinhas, mimosas refrescantes e cafÃ© aromÃ¡tico. ServiÃ§o atencioso e ambiente acolhedor fazem dele uma experiÃªncia que valoriza cada detalhe.
Everything was absolutely wonderful, table was wobbly because we were seated outside on top of the cellar door but thatâ€™s because everyone wanted a taste of this amazing food?
Terrible place
A comfortable, never rushed, spacious room with delicious food and warm, professional service.

Pricey good food.
Service could be more attentive.
Reservation needed.
æ€§ä»·æ¯”å¾ˆä¸€èˆ¬

Sarabeth's  UWS has a new Manager and it shows.  Last time I was there the service was so poor I vowed never to return. We went back again to give it one more try because the breakfasts are so good! Donato, the new manager, was so friendly and you could tell has a good relationship with his staff. The experience was night and day. Our server, Veronica, was attentive and friendly. Truly 5 stars.  Our special requests were taken care of no problem, The food arrived quickly and was presented well. As per reputation, the popover was delicious and eggs benedict on point with a soft unique bread. Omelette delicious as well and accompanying greens were fresh and perfectly dressed. The only reason for 4 not 5 stars on the food is because the muffins were on the dry side and re atmosphere the whole place just feels a bit 'tired'. But with Donato now at the helm I highly recommend this restaurant.
Very very Good !
One of the best lunches I've had in a long time. Grilled cheese and tomato soup was delicious. Service was fantastic

If you never visited please do. A friend of mine took us to breakfast. It was amazing. The service was excellent. The food was outstanding. I love that the eggs come with a small salad on the plate with delicious homemade dressing. The lemon ricotta pancakes are a must. You can mos definitely share them. I also had chicken sausage and the bacon was a hit. Another time we came for lunch and the burgers were delicious. As well as the chicken pot pie but you can't get it before 4 pm.
I visit 3 Sarabeths in the city and I enjoy eating at every one of them.

Letâ€™s start with the good news - the sarabeth salad was great.

Now the tough stuff.

Tables of 8 seated 20 minutes early - table for 3 with an 88 year old forced to sit outside for 15 minutes after reservation time as the rain started.

Noise levels inside regularly hitting over 105dB (yep Sarabeth check the OSHA rules)

I feel for the staff who are regularly exposed to these noise levels and will possibly suffer hearing damage

Great food and drinks. Fun breakfast spot. I highly recommend going for a walk across Central Park and then the MET. It makes for a great morning weekend date.
Fancy dinner its nothing special.
Wholesome and delicious ğŸ˜‹

This was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had.  Me and my best friend came here and The ambiance was exquisite and the service was top tier. The food was delicious and really made the experiences here amazing!!!

Sarabethâ€™s is the sparkling treasure of the Upper West Side! The staff are so loving and attentive, the space is gorgeous, and the food is always perfection! We recently went for a special get together and had the best time! This is my go-to brunch spot. Go to there!
Always happy with my meal at Sarabeth's.  This is why I keep coming back!

Tuesday night. I asked mom why we were eating here, she said bc itâ€™s quiet and she could hear everyone. Mom is 82 this place has definitely gone downhill since I was here last. Menu way smaller and much more expensive. Waitress m.i.a. Most of the meal dad had to get up to find what Iâ€™m guessing was a busboy who did actually take our order. Same guy delivered the meals. Waitress after missing for well over 45m finally came back and asked if we were happy with our decisions (?) super weird light switches touched by her next to our table were disgusting I hope she washed her hands after touching them $200 meal for 4 incl 5 drinks total

This is a great place to have brunch on the weekends and enjoy it with family or friends.
The dishes are well served and very tasty, the recipe for the riccota lemon pancakes is a bit different than the first time I tried them, maybe less moist, but still good flavor. About the place, it is a classic NY place, however, they could take better care of the bathrooms.

The attention and service of the waiter who served us stands out; very friendly and willing to answer questions and make recommendations (essential when you have children with you).

In general, a pleasant experience.

Sarabethâ€™s Upper West Side serves up a great breakfast. The menu has the usual suspects for an American style breakfast. Omelettes packed with cheese along with vegetables and meats depending on the order. Service courteous and prompt. If your cell phone isnâ€™t working, you can make a call from the pay phone in the basement. Do have some gluten free options.
Love to have brunch at Sarabethâ€™s. The chicken buttermilk sandwich was amazing. And lavender lemonadeâ€¦ soooo delicious. Service is great, perfect time to go is 11:30am. ğŸ¤©

Arrived around 11:30a with ample seating available. The staff was attentive, friendly & efficient. Had the Eggs Benedict which had the richest Hollandaise sauce & perfectly salty ham. But that English muffin- I'd make the trip just for that! Daughter had the French toast which was fluffy, hot and soaked up all the butter and maple syrup (not eggy like some places) making for the perfect bite. I'd suggest adding a side of the ham because the saltiness of that and the sweet of the maple syrup is something special. The perfect amount of food before gallivanting around the city.

We went to brunch with my coworkers, and it was incredible! The food was delicious, and the service was excellent. Iâ€™ll definitely be back! The Bellinis were amazing, and the Lemon Pancakes were super tasty!

Loved this place.  Very cute, intimate, peaceful place with outstanding food!  Michelle took great care of us.  I especially enjoyed the lemon and herb braised chicken with fingerling potatotes from the Restaurant Week special menu.  I hope that becomes a regular dish- so tender and the sauce was amazing! A new favorite place ğŸ˜€

We celebrated my husbandâ€™s early Bday dinner yesterday at Sarabethâ€™s UWS location, and it was such a delightful evening! From the front entrance, entire staff were extremely friendly and courteous. We dined really early, so it was quite in the restaurant which was perfect for us. Food was great and drinks were strong and delicious. Everything was great but Chicken Pot Pie was our favorite. It was savory, creamy and rich. Chocolate toffee cake was extremely rich and delicious as well. Overall, a really pleasant evening thanks to wonderful staff and great food!

The restaurant week $30 two-course lunch was quite good. The watermelon and pumpkin seeds added textural contrast to the gazpacho, while the avocado gave it some richness. The doubled dipped crispy chicken was served on a bed of cabbage salad. The amount of dressing was just right but it could have done away with the cornbread croutons as there were not crisp or but rather dry and crumbly. Price-wise this offer is almost getting the first course for free as most plates are around the $30.
Food was scrumptious and delicious.Ordered lobster roll which  fresh and yummy and chips were crispy too.Also had Chicken Sandwich with fries both were Soo tasty.

Showing it's age...  It might be Amazing for tourists, but the competition is stiff on the UWS.  Everything is showing it's age at this point, and it's time for a refresh...
Service was Good - but not Excellent, Good was Good - but not Excellent and Atmosphere is a little less than good with chairs that are loose, dirt in the corners and the crevices.
It's time to close down for a week, clean up, shape up and start fresh.  You guys are Better than this

Super consigliato dopo una mattinata al museo di storia naturale!
Uova alla benedict.. perfette, insalata e dolce non banali, conto onesto e prosecco al bicchiere finalmente frizzante come appena aperto!ğŸ˜

One of the best breakfast places over tried so far. The food is amazing and thereâ€™s no way to describe how good it is. Everything we got tasted perfect and very well made.

The only bad thing is: everything is very expensive in Manhattan, I get it. The food was totally worth the price so it was not a problem. But when it comes to the orange juice thatâ€™s where I see thereâ€™s something wrong. $12 a glass of orange juice that is not even fresh and squeezed at the moment. Iâ€™m very picky when it comes to that and I definitely know when an orange juice is fresh squeezed, but paying $12 for a glass where you can see they pouring it in a cup from a gallon is very disappointing. Many places (most of them) serve artificial orange juice. I get it. But they have a different price for that. All my experience in going out for brunch or breakfast where I ordered orange juice, I never paid that much for an artificial one.

So this is the only crazy thing I saw and I experienced. I would definitely go back but not ordering the orange juice again.

Overall, everything was perfect and tasty.

Mala atenciÃ³n del host al llegar y muy mala disposiciÃ³n en ayudar al Cliente, el servicio de los chicos de la barra fue muy bueno. La comida no me gustÃ³ en lo absoluto los huevos benedictos estaban muy crudos y el avocado toast muy salado, la panquecas  llegaron frÃ­as. No volverÃ­a a ir a este sitio no lo recomiendo.

I haven't explored numerous brunch destinations in New York City, but Sarabeth's, situated on the Upper West Side, marked my inaugural experience. My husband and I opted for a brunch outing, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations. The buttermilk pancakes and crispy chicken sandwich we selected were a delight. Accompanied by their timeless mimosa and a passionista, our meal was thoroughly enjoyable. If you find yourself uncertain about where to indulge in brunch, I wholeheartedly recommend giving this establishment a try
